page.title: 03FARMING IN PLAISH
page.content: Plaish is small hamlet about 12 miles from the nearest market town, Shrewsbury.The main industry in the area is agriculture.The type of farming practised is mixed, Dairy, livestock and some arable.During the early summer,silage and hay are made, to be followed by the harvesting of the corn with a combine-harvester. The straw is baled into quite large round bales weighing about 400kg.each. The grain_wheat,oats & barley,is dried and stored in silos of about 50 tonnes capacity. After the harvest,the fields are ploughed,cultivated and resown with crops for the following year. Pedigree Hereford cattle are bred at one farm.A great deal of work goes into rearing and preparing young bulls for sale as Herd Sires,mainly for the Dairy herds.
